phrases.text: Tềnh là tềnh tang tềnh tang tềnh
phrases.english: Teng la teng tang teng tang teng (vocables)

culturalContext.description: Rhythmic vocables typical of Vietnamese work songs
facts: Tềnh tang patterns imitate rhythmic sounds of labor
Traditional work song form coordinating group effort
Vocables help synchronize physical movements during collective work

phrases.text: Bắc cầu anh sẽ có ván mong
phrases.english: Building a bridge, I hope to have planks

culturalContext.description: Bridge-building as metaphor for connection and courtship
facts: Building bridges symbolizes creating connections between communities
Wooden planks were precious materials in rural Vietnam
Bridges often featured in courtship songs as meeting places
culturalContext.musicalContext: Transition from vocables to narrative content

phrases.text: Em sang là sang chẳng được rằng
phrases.english: You want to cross but can't quite manage

culturalContext.description: Obstacle preventing crossing, creating need for help
facts: Rural rivers/streams often difficult to cross without bridges
Gender roles: women needed assistance crossing water
Sets up romantic offer of assistance

phrases.text: Để anh bồng anh bồng qua nọ
phrases.english: Let me carry you, let me carry you across

culturalContext.description: Romantic offer to carry beloved across water
facts: Bồng means to carry tenderly (typically children or loved ones)
Repetition emphasizes eagerness and sincerity
Physical closeness of carrying creates intimate moment

phrases.text: Tềnh là tềnh tang tềnh tang tềnh
phrases.english: Teng la teng tang teng tang teng (vocables)

facts: Repeated refrain provides musical continuity
Separates romantic section from work section
Allows singers to rest voice before next narrative

phrases.text: Trồng bông ta luống a đậu luống đậu luống a cà
phrases.english: Planting cotton in rows, beans in rows, beans in rows, eggplant in rows

facts: Traditional Vietnamese polyculture: cotton, beans, eggplant together
Luống (raised bed) technique for flood-prone areas
Repetition mirrors physical repetition of planting rows
culturalContext.musicalContext: Shift from romance to agricultural labor theme

phrases.text: Ai làm cho luống công ta thế này chứ đường
phrases.english: Who made our communal rows turn out like this, tell me?

culturalContext.description: Rhetorical question about collective farming results
facts: Công refers to collective/communal work system
Rhetorical question implies shared responsibility or blame
Traditional Vietnamese agriculture often cooperative

phrases.text: Ai làm cho luống công đây
phrases.english: Who made our communal rows like this?

facts: Repetition structure common in work songs
Builds camaraderie through shared questioning
Collective identity reinforced through 'ta' (we/our)
culturalContext.musicalContext: Refrain with slight variation from previous question
